Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
GameBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class GameBoard
extends javax.swing.JFrame
This class provides a graphical model of a board game. The class creates a rectangular panel of clickable squares. If a square is clicked by the user a method is invoked upon the corresponding GameSquare instance. The class is intended to be used as a basis for tile based games.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard​(java.lang.String title, int width, int height, java.lang.String squareType)
      Create a new game board of the given size. As soon as an instance of this class is created, it is visualized on the screen.
      Parameters:
      title - the name printed in the window bar.
      width - the width of the game area, in squares.
      height - the height of the game area, in squares.
      squareType - the name of the class to construct for each position on the board. Required to be a concrete subclass of GameSquare.

  • Method Details

    • getSquareAt

      public GameSquare getSquareAt​(int x, int y)
      Returns the GameSquare instance at a given location.
      Parameters:
      x - the x co-ordinate of the square requested.
      y - the y co-ordinate of the square requested.
      Returns:
      the GameSquare instance at a given location if the x and y co-ordinates are valid - null otherwise.
